se.ltu.android.demo.scene.camera
Class Camera

java.lang.Object
  se.ltu.android.demo.scene.camera.Camera

public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object

A class representing a camera. It's an abstract representation of anything needed to create an OpenGL view.

Version:
$Revision: 24 $

Method Detail

setPerspective

public static void setPerspective(float fovy,
                                  float width,
                                  float height,
                                  float zNear,
                                  float zFar)
Set the projection matrix, similar to gluPerspective.

Parameters:
fovy - Field of view angle in y coordinate
width - Width of screen
height - Height of screen
zNear - Distance to near-plane
zFar - Distance to far-plane

getProjectionM

public static float[] getProjectionM()
Returns:
the projection matrix

setModelM

public void setModelM(float[] m)
Parameters:
m - the model-view matrix to set

setRotationM

public void setRotationM(float[] rotM)
Sets the cameras rotation matrix. This is similar to setting the model view matrix but it keeps the cameras current position.

Parameters:
rotM - rotation matrix to set

getModelM

public float[] getModelM()
Returns:
the model view matrix

lookAt

public void lookAt(float eyex,
                   float eyey,
                   float eyez,
                   float centerx,
                   float centery,
                   float centerz,
                   float upx,
                   float upy,
                   float upz)
Define a viewing transformation in terms of an eye point, a center of view, and an up vector.

Parameters:
eyex - eye x coordinate
eyey - eye y coordinate
eyez - eye z coordinate
centerx - view center x coordinate
centery - view center y coordinate
centerz - view center z coordinate
upx - up vector x coordinate
upy - up vector y coordinate
upz - up vector z coordinate

translate

public void translate(float x,
                      float y,
                      float z)
Translate the cameras position with the given coordinates

Parameters:
x - translation x coordinate
y - translation y coordinate
z - translation z coordinate

translate

public void translate(float[] vector3f)
Translate the cameras position with the given coordinates

Parameters:
vector3f - an array of size three, containing x,y and z coordinates

getPosition

public float[] getPosition()
Returns:
the current position

setIdentity

public void setIdentity()
Set the cameras model view matrix to the identity matrix

setPosition

public void setPosition(float x,
                        float y,
                        float z)
Set the absolute position of this camera

Parameters:
x - x coordinate
y - y coordinate
z - z coordinate

calculatePickRay

public Ray calculatePickRay(float pickX,
                            float pickY)
Calculates a pick ray based on the given screen coordinates and the current projection matrix and model view matrix. The screen coordinates are expected to have (0,0) at the upper left corner of the screen and the y-axis is reversed compared to the OpenGL y-axis.

Parameters:
pickX - screen x coordinate
pickY - screen y coordinate
